Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For information about the COM object, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AllCaps { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.AllCaps : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the font is formatted as all capital letters. Returns True, False, or wdUndefined (a mixture of True and False). Can be set to True, False, or wdToggle (reverses the current setting). Read/write Integer.

remarks.para: Setting AllCaps to True sets to False, and vice versa.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ContextualAlternates { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ContextualAlternates : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not contextual alternates are enabled for the specified font.

remarks.para: Contextual alternates are ligatures that are applied to individual characters based on the letters around them (their context). Contextual alternates can also be applied to entire words in certain contexts, for example, words frequently used in titles (such as "of" and "the"). When contextual alternates are enabled for a font, they are used instead of the standard ligatures in those contexts defined by the font designer.Setting this property has the same effect as selecting the check box next to Use Contextual Alternates (in the OpenType Features group, Advanced tab, on the Font dialog in Word 2010).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created. Read-only Integer.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor DiacriticColor { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor value); };
member this.DiacriticColor : Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdColor with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the 24-bit color to be used for diacritics for the specified object. Can be any valid constant or a value returned by Visual Basic's RGB function. Read/write.

remarks.para: The value of the property must be True in order to use this property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DoubleStrikeThrough { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.DoubleStrikeThrough : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the specified font is formatted as double strikethrough text. Returns True, False, or wdUndefined (a mixture of True and False). Can be set to True, False, or wdToggle. Read/write Integer.

remarks.para: To set or return single-line strikethrough formatting, use the property. Setting DoubleStrikeThrough to True sets StrikeThrough to False, and vice versa.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Duplicate As Font
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Font ^ Duplicate { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Font ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a read-only object that represents the character formatting of the specified font.

remarks.para: You can use the Duplicate property to pick up the settings of all the properties of a duplicated Font, object, or object.

You can assign the object returned by the Duplicate property to another object of the same type to apply those settings all at once. Before assigning the duplicate object to another object, you can change any of the properties of the duplicate object without affecting the original.

Docs.summary: True if the specified font is formatted as embossed. Returns True, False, or wdUndefined. Can be set to True, False, or wdToggle. Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Grow() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Increases the font size to the next available size. If the selection or range contains more than one font size, each size is increased to the next available setting.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Hidden { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Hidden : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the font is formatted as hidden text. Returns True, False or wdUndefined (a mixture of True and False). Can be set to True, False, or wdToggle. Read/write Integer.

remarks.para: To control the display of hidden text, use the property of the object.
To control whether properties and methods that return objects include or exclude hidden text when hidden text isn't displayed, use the property of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Kerning { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Kerning : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the minimum font size for which Microsoft Word will adjust kerning automatically. Read/write Single.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLigatures Ligatures { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLigatures get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLigatures value); };
member this.Ligatures : Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdLigatures with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ligatures setting for the specified Font object.

remarks.para: Read/write WdLigatures. Open Type fonts support the use of ligatures. This property specifies the Word 2010 ligature setting to apply to an Open Type font.
The following table lists the four basic values for ligatures.

item.description: Designed to enhance readability and attractiveness. Standard ligatures in Latin languages include "fi", "fl", and "ff".
Designed to enhance readability and attractiveness by providing the best ligature choice given the surrounding text.
Older, ornamental ligatures that may look archaic to the modern reader. Not specifically designed for readability.
Designed to be ornamental and not designed to be readable.

remarks.para: Combinations of these four basic values form the set of available values for this property. This set of values is represented in the enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::LineFormat ^ Line { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::LineFormat ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::LineFormat ^ value); };
member this.Line : Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.LineFormat with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets a object that specifies the formatting for a line.

remarks.para: Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Name : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the specified object. Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NameAscii { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NameAscii : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the font used for Latin text (characters with character codes from 0 (zero) through 127). Read/write String.

remarks.para: In the U.S. English version of Microsoft Word, the default value of this property is Times New Roman. Use the property to change the font that's applied to all text and that appears in the Font box on the Formatting toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NameBi { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NameBi : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the font in a right-to-left language document. Read/write String.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NameFarEast { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NameFarEast : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an East Asian font name. Read/write String.

remarks.para: In the U.S. English version of Microsoft Word, the default value of this property is Times New Roman. This is the recommended way to return or set the font for Asian text in a document created in an Asian version of Word.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ NameOther { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.NameOther : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the font used for characters with character codes from 128 through 255. Read/write String.

remarks.para: In the U.S. English version of Microsoft Word, the default value of this property is Times New Roman. Use the property to change the font that's applied to all text and that appears in the Font box on the Formatting toolbar.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdNumberForm NumberForm { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdNumberForm get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdNumberForm value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the number form setting for an OpenType font.

remarks.para: Read/write WdNumberForm. Numbers in OpenType fonts can be displayed either with consistent heights along the baseline of the text (called "lining"), or with varying heights (called "hanging" or "old style") where numbers are displayed above or below the baseline of the text. Use this property to specify whether numbers are displayed using lining or old-style.
Setting this property has the same effect as selecting an item in the dropdown box next to Number forms: (OpenType features group, Advanced tab in the Font dialog box in Word 2010).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdNumberSpacing NumberSpacing { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdNumberSpacing get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdNumberSpacing value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number spacing setting for a font.

remarks.para: Read/write WdNumberSpacing. OpenType fonts support a proportional and tabular figure feature to control number spacing. Proportional number spacing handles each number as having a different width. For example, "1" is displayed as narrower than "5". Tabular number spacing handles numbers as equal in width so that they align vertically, which increases the readability, especially for financial information.

member this.Outline : int with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the font is formatted as outline. Returns True, False, or wdUndefined (a mixture of True and False). Can be set to True, False, or wdToggle. Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes manual character formatting (formatting not applied using a style).

remarks.para: If you manually format a word as bold and the underlying style is plain text (not bold), the Reset method removes the bold format.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the scaling percentage applied to the font. This property stretches or compresses text horizontally as a percentage of the current size (the scaling range is from 1 through 600). Read/write Integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetAsTemplateDefault() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sets the specified font formatting as the default for the active document and all new documents based on the active template. The default font formatting is stored in the Normal style.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdStylisticSet StylisticSet { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdStylisticSet get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdStylisticSet value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the stylistic set for the specified font.

remarks.para: Read/write WdStylisticSet. Some OpenType fonts provide stylistic sets. A stylistic set defines a set of characters within the font that are intended to be used together, usually for the purpose of visual harmony, such as in headings.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor UnderlineColor { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the 24-bit color of the underline for the specified object.

remarks.para: Can be any valid constant or a value returned by Visual Basic's RGB function.
Setting the UnderlineColor property to wdColorAutomatic resets the color of the underline to the color of the text above it.
